FRBRalias.value: The Assam Medicare Service Persons And Medicare Service Institutions (Prevention Of Violence And Damage To Property) Act, 2011

p.shortTitle: The Assam Medicare Service Persons And Medicare Service Institutions (Prevention Of Violence And Damage To Property) Act, 2011

preamble.p: to prohibit violence against Medicare Service Persons and damage to Property of Medicare Service Institutions in the State of Assam and for matters connected therewith and incidental thereto.

Whereas it is expedient to prohibit violence against Medicare Service Persons and damage to Property of Medicare Service Institutions in the State of Assam and matters connected therewith or incidental thereto;
It is hereby enacted in the Sixty-second Year of the Republic of India as follows:

content.p: The Act may be called the Assam Medicare Service Persons and Medicare Service Institutions (Prevention of Violence and Damage to Property) Act, 2011.
It extends to the whole of the State of Assam.
It shall come into force at once.

blockList.listIntroduction: In the Act, unless the context otherwise requires,

item.p: "Medicare Service" means the act of providing medical treatment and care including antenatal and postnatal care in connection with child birth or anything connected therewith, or nursing care in any form to, persons suffering from any sickness, injury or infirmities whether of body or mind;

"Medicare Service Institutions" means a medical college, or a hospital by whatever name called or such other institution providing Medicare Service to the people, which is established and managed by or under the control of the State Government or Central Government or any local authority or any private person or persons, and includes a maternity home or convalescent home;

blockList.listIntroduction: "Medicare Service Persons" in relation to Medicare Service Institution shall include,

item.p: Registered Medical Practitioners, working in Medicare Institutions (including those having provisional Registration);
Any Para-medical or any other worker employed and working in Medicare Service Institutions;

"Property of Medicare Service Institution" means the building and equipments of the Medicare Service Institution. It also includes personal vehicles and other equipments etc. brought to the premises or to the vicinity of the premises by the Medicare Service Person in connection with his/her duties;

"Violence" means activity of causing any harm, injury or endangering the life or intimidation, obstruction or hindrance to any Medicare Service Person in discharge of duty in a Medicare Service Institution or damage to property of the Medicare Service Institution.

section.heading: Offences against Medicare Service Persons and Medicare Service Institutions

blockList.listIntroduction: Following acts by any members of the public shall be an offence for the purposes of this Act:

item.p: Violence against any Medicare Service Person;
Damage to any property of the Medicare Service Institution or to any Medicare Service Person

content.p: Whoever commits any offence as defined in section 3 shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and with fine which may extend to fifty thousand rupees.

section.heading: Offence to be Cognizable and non-bailable

content.p: Any offence punishable under section 3, shall be cognizable and non-bailable.

section.heading: Recovery of loss for the damage caused to the property

content.p: In addition to the punishment provided in section 3, the Court shall, when passing judgment, order the accused person to pay, by way of compensation, such amount as may be specified in the order for the damage or loss caused to the Property of the Medicare Service Institutions:
Provided that in case of damage or loss caused to any Property of Medicare Service Institution, the quantum of compensation shall not be less than the amount of purchase price of such property.

Where the order of compensation made under subÂ¬section (1) is not paid, the same shall be recovered under the provisions of the Bengal Public Demands Recovery Act, 1913 (Bengal Act 3 of 1913) from the accused person as if it were an arrear of land revenue.

section.heading: Act not in derogation of any other law

content.p: The provisions of this Act shall be in addition to and not in derogation of the provisions of any other law, for the time being in force.
